# Arpeggio: add4 in F# (Shape: C)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played sequentially rather than simultaneously. The "add4" in this arpeggio refers to adding the fourth note of the scale to the chord, creating a unique and colorful sound.

## Notes and Intervals

The arpeggio in F# with the shape of C consists of the following notes and intervals:

- F# (1)
- A# (3)
- C# (5)
- B (4)

The arpeggio includes the root note (F#), the major third (A#), the perfect fifth (C#), and the added fourth (B).

## Genre and Musical Flavor

This arpeggio, particularly with the added fourth, has a dreamy and ethereal quality. It is often used in genres such as ambient music, post-rock, and jazz to create lush and atmospheric soundscapes. The added fourth note adds an element of tension and intrigue to the chord, providing a sense of mystery and complexity to the music.

2. **Song Title:** "Beyond the Horizon"
